p: Each single test consisted of 20 larvae of Rhynchophorus ferrugineus which was taken into 500 ml beaker that have a certain volume (150, 100, 200, 250 and 300 ml) of dechlorinated tap water PH (7.4). N. glauca preparations were added with the following concentration; (1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, and 3 ml), besides dechlorinated tap water as a contrl. Each test was based on three replications. The perished larvae was counted and recorded after 24 h of exposure.
